Expectation1: Repair or replace damaged wooden structures or components
Situation1: A homeowner reports a damaged wooden deck, and the carpenter needs to repair or replace it to restore functionality
Expectation2: Attend weekly church services to worship and participate in community activities
Situation2: They think about joining Sunday worship when time allows
Story:
I stood in the middle of the homeowner’s backyard, eyeing the splintered boards of the deck. The damage was worse than I’d expected, and the family was counting on me to fix it before their daughter’s birthday party next week. I could already hear the urgency in their voices, the hope that I’d restore their gathering place in time. I measured, planned, and realized the only way to finish was to work through the weekend—especially Sunday.

But Sunday was the one day I tried to set aside for church. My faith taught me to honor the Sabbath, to gather with others, to worship and find rest. I’d missed a few services lately, always telling myself I’d go when time allowed. Now, as I ran my hand over the rough wood, I felt the weight of both roles pressing down. The family’s need for my skills, my promise to them, and my own longing for spiritual renewal all tangled together. I stood there, torn, wondering which expectation I would have to let down.
